instructions: All questions are compulsory.
Use of a calculator is not allowed.
The numbers to the right of the questions indicate full marks.
In case of MCQs (Q. No. 1(A)) only the first attempt will be evaluated and will be given credit.

For every MCQ, the correct alternative (A), (B), (C) or (D) with sub-question number is to be written as an answer 
 For Eg.: (i) (A), (ii) (B), (iii) (C) or (iv) (D)
Scientifically correct, labelled diagrams should be drawn wherever necessary.
Each new question should be started on the new page.
Read all the instructions carefully before starting the exam.
This question paper contains questions of varying difficulty levels.
All questions are compulsory unless stated otherwise.
Answers must be written using a blue or black ink pen. Pencils are allowed only for drawing or diagrams.
Avoid overwriting, cutting, or erasing as much as possible to maintain clarity.
Write the question number correctly before each answer.
Use the additional sheets provided if necessary, but ensure they are tied together with the main answer sheet.
Fill in all required details like name, roll number, and other information on the answer sheet.
Ensure your roll number matches the one mentioned on your admit card.
Verify that the question paper provided matches your subject and class.
Use the first 15 minutes to read the question paper (as per CBSE guidelines).
The question paper is divided into sections: A, B, C, and D.
Section A consists of objective-type questions such as MCQs, fill-in-the-blanks, or true/false.
Section B consists of short-answer questions.
Section C and D consist of long-answer questions requiring detailed explanations.
Diagrams, flowcharts, or tabular formats can be used to enhance your answers.
Marks for each question are indicated in the right margin.
Partial marks may be awarded for partially correct answers.
For numerical problems, steps will carry marks even if the final answer is incorrect.
Diagrams and illustrations must be labeled clearly to secure full marks.
There is no negative marking unless explicitly mentioned.
The duration of the exam is 3 hours unless specified otherwise.
Allocate time wisely to each section based on the marks distribution.
Reserve the last 10-15 minutes for revising your answers.
Do not spend too much time on one question.
You may carry pens, pencils, erasers, sharpeners, and a geometry box.
Scientific calculators are allowed only for specified subjects like Physics or Mathematics if mentioned.
Logarithmic tables or formula sheets are allowed for certain subjects if provided by the examination authority.
Your admit card and school ID are mandatory for entry.
Electronic gadgets such as mobile phones, smartwatches, and calculators (unless permitted) are not allowed.
Do not bring any books, notes, or written materials to the exam hall.
Carrying chits, unauthorized papers, or other aids will result in disqualification.
Avoid wearing any electronic devices or accessories.
Maintain silence and discipline in the exam hall.
Raise your hand if you have any doubts or need additional sheets.
Do not look around or attempt to communicate with other students.
Any form of cheating or malpractice will lead to cancellation of your paper.
Follow the instructions of the invigilators at all times.
Write answers in clear and legible handwriting.
For subjects like Mathematics and Science, show all calculations and steps clearly.
Draw diagrams neatly using a pencil and label them appropriately.
Underline or highlight key points to make your answers stand out.
Attempt questions in the order they appear in the question paper for clarity.
Ensure your roll number and other details are correctly filled in on the answer sheet.
Double-check that all your answer sheets, including supplements, are tied together.
Sign the attendance sheet before leaving the exam hall.
Hand over both the question paper (if required) and the answer sheets to the invigilator.
Do not leave the exam hall before the completion of the exam unless allowed.
Wear a mask throughout the examination.
Sanitize your hands before entering the exam hall.
Maintain social distancing at all times.
Bring your own stationery to avoid sharing.
Follow the seating arrangement provided to maintain safety protocols.

instructions.subject: Mathematics
details: Use only a pencil for graphs and geometric constructions.
Ensure all steps are shown clearly for full marks.
Highlight final answers by underlining or boxing them.

instructions.subject: Science
details: Write equations clearly and balance them correctly.
Use correct units for numerical answers.

instructions.subject: Languages
details: Write essays and long answers in paragraphs.
Use appropriate grammar, punctuation, and spelling.
Adhere to the word limit specified for each question.

instructions.subject: Social Science
details: For map-based questions, use the map provided and mark correctly.
Answers should be concise and to the point.
Mention dates and historical facts accurately.
